perturbation.original_text: The Fee shall be payable to Charity Tunes in two equal installments of $58,802.80  (plus applicable taxes) due to Charity Tunes on October 1, 2009 and November 1, 2009, respectively payable upon receipt of  invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: The Fee shall be payable to Charity Tunes in one installment of $117,605.60 (plus applicable taxes) due to Charity Tunes 120 days after receipt of invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the payment term to 120 days, which is a significant delay that could be deemed an unfair business practice, depending on industry standards and applicable Canadian provincial prompt payment legislation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of provincial prompt payment legislation in Canada, or general principles of good faith and fair dealing in commercial contracts.

perturbation.original_text: In consideration of the fees paid by Sponsor as set out herein, Charity Tunes agrees that during the period beginning October  1, 2009 and ending March 31, 2010, Charity Tunes shall not enable another program sponsorship for all competitive  products/product categories distributed/sold within the total Canadian consumer/retail/wholesale market place, inclusive of:     - Total Frozen Handhelds     - Total Corporation General Mills Handhelds     - Total Pizza Pops Handhelds / total Pillsbury Mini Pizzas     - Total Corporation McCain Foods Handhelds     - Total Pizza Pockets / total McCain Mini Pizzas     - Total Corporation Heinz Handhelds     - Total Heinz Hot bites (Bagel Bites and Taco Bites) / total Anchor Poppers     - Total Corporation Schneider Foods Handhelds     - Total Hot Stuffs / total Lean Stuffs     - Total Resers Burritos     - Total Corp les Plats du Chef Handhelds     - Total Hinsdale Farms Corndogs
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration of the fees paid by Sponsor as set out herein, Charity Tunes agrees that during the period beginning October  1, 2009 and for the remainder of the existence of Charity Tunes, Charity Tunes shall not enable another program sponsorship for all products sold within Canada.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an unreasonably broad and perpetual exclusivity clause. It restricts Charity Tunes from working with any other company in Canada for any product category for the life of the company, which is likely to be deemed an unenforceable restraint of trade under Canadian competition law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Canadian Competition Act, specifically provisions regarding unreasonable restraint of trade.

perturbation.original_text: All notices required or permitted to be given under this Agreement shall be given in writing and shall be delivered,  either personally or by express delivery service, to the party to be notified. Notice to each party shall be deemed to have been  duly given upon delivery, personally or by courier, addressed to the attention of the officer at the address set forth heretofore, or  to such other officer or addresses as either party may designate, upon at least ten days written notice, to the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: All notices required or permitted to be given under this Agreement may be given orally. Oral notice shall be considered properly given. No written record of said notice is required.
perturbation.explanation: This eliminates the requirement for written notice and allows for oral notice, contradicting basic contract law principles that require certain notices (especially those with legal consequences) to be in writing to ensure clarity and proof of delivery. This also conflicts with typical requirements for proper legal notification.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law requiring clear and provable notice, as well as standard legal practices for formal notification.
